p: When evaluating clinical disease, no significant difference in the number of participants experiencing at least one symptom was observed between the groups (Table 2). However, there was a statistically significant reduction in the number of participants who experienced at least two or more symptoms during their infection between those who received single-dose FLU-v and those who received placebo (40% vs 64.3%, p = 0.024). A smaller reduction in the two-dose FLU-v group (56.1%) compared to placebo in the participants with at least two or more symptoms ( p = 0.296) was also observed but not significant (Table 2).
